intro: Thrixspermum sarawakense, commonly known as the Sarawak starfruit, is a climbing shrub native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malesherbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its fruit is a fleshy, star-shaped berry that contains several seeds. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
